de.dfki.lt.hfc.server

Class HfcServerApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.server.HfcServerApi

  • public class HfcServerApi
extends java.lang.Object
    the server API that is separated from the server otself; note that certain information is statically mirrored, e.g., HFC and QUERY

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static ForwardChainer HFC
      this class instance of class ForwardChainer is assigned when starting the HFC Web Server
      protected static Query QUERY
      this class instance of class Query is assigned when starting the HFC Web Server

      HfcServerApi() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean ask(java.lang.String command)
      checks whether a ground tuple is an element of the set of all tuples
      java.lang.Boolean closure(java.lang.String command)
      computes the deductive closure for the HFC repository
      java.lang.String query(java.lang.String query)
      queries the query store derived from HFC's tuple store; the query store is assigned globally to the static field QUERY
      java.lang.Integer start(java.lang.String command)
      starts the HFC server, but NOT the web server; note: web server port remains unchanged NOTE: this method is supposed to be called ADMINISTRATORS only; NOTE: similar to the main method in class HfcServer without port number sepecification; USAGE: start ^+ NOTE: closure computation must be called explicitly
      java.lang.Integer stop(java.lang.String command)
      stops the HFC server, but NOT the web server
      java.lang.String upload(java.lang.String command)
      upload a tuple file

      • HfcServerApi

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public java.lang.String query(java.lang.String query)
        queries the query store derived from HFC's tuple store; the query store is assigned globally to the static field QUERY
        Returns:
        a string representation of the query result/the binding table

      • ask

        public java.lang.Boolean ask(java.lang.String command)
        checks whether a ground tuple is an element of the set of all tuples
        Returns:
        true iff tuple is contained in the repository

      • upload

        public java.lang.String upload(java.lang.String command)
        upload a tuple file
        Returns:
        true iff everything went well

      • closure

        public java.lang.Boolean closure(java.lang.String command)
        computes the deductive closure for the HFC repository
        Returns:
        true iff new tuples have been generated

      • start

        public java.lang.Integer start(java.lang.String command)
        starts the HFC server, but NOT the web server; note: web server port remains unchanged NOTE: this method is supposed to be called ADMINISTRATORS only; NOTE: similar to the main method in class HfcServer without port number sepecification; USAGE: start ^+ NOTE: closure computation must be called explicitly

      • stop

        public java.lang.Integer stop(java.lang.String command)
        stops the HFC server, but NOT the web server
        Returns:
        0 iff shutdown succeeds
